item.title: Street lighting not working, low visibility at night, 10th November
item.description:
People tend to cross here when the traffic light is on red. Currently the street light closest to the crossing is out, it's hard to see pedestrians/cyclists in the evenings as it gets dark so early. It's very dangerous situation as vehicles from the right in the pictures travel at high speed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peartree Way, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Motorised vehicles using pedestrian footpath at Somerleyton Passage – ongoing issue, 10th November
item.description:
Motorised vehicles, including motorbikes and delivery drivers, are regularly using the pedestrian footpath at Somerleyton Passage (between Somerleyton Road and Mayall Road, SW9). This route is intended for pedestrians only, but it has become a shortcut for riders since the Low Traffic Neighbourhood (LTN) was introduced several years ago. Many of the vehicles travel at high speed, and I have witnessed several near misses where motorbikes have had to swerve to avoid hitting pedestrians. It is an accident waiting to happen. This issue has been ongoing for years, since 2021. It has been reported to both Lambeth Council and the police, but no effective measures have been taken to prevent unauthorised vehicle access. The situation poses a serious risk to public safety and urgently needs enforcement or physical barriers to stop vehicles entering the passage. Location: Somerleyton Passage, between Somerleyton Road and Mayall Road, SW9 (beneath the Victoria train line).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Somerleyton Passage, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spray paint on 3 CCTV cameras, 10th November
item.description:
Hello please could the 3 cameras located in the alley way underneath Chadwick court be replaced as they have been vandalized with graffiti and no longer are able to monitor the area correctly. The address is Chadwick court Titmus avenue thamesmead London se28 Thank you

item.title: Advertising trailer dumped on grass area, 10th November
item.description:
This advertising trailer has been dumped in the area at the junction with The Grove and Danson Road. This is wrong on so many levels. It ruins the grass, is illegally dumped , looks unsightly and gives free advertising for said company. Please get it removed as soon as possible. Thank you.
